parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
However, nevertheless, but, except that, yet. From pleion; moreover, i.e. Albeit, save that, rather, yet.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From the same as trope; a turn, i.e. mode or style; figuratively, deportment or character.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.
A pretext, an excuse. From a compound of pro and phaino; an outward showing, i.e. Pretext.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To declare openly, proclaim, preach, laud, celebrate. From kata and the base of aggelos; to proclaim, promulgate.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.
